title: K-Planes vs NeRF Architecture Comparison
setup: Systematic comparison of K-Planes (multiplicative and additive), GA-Planes, and NeRF variants on 2D matrix reconstruction. Test linear, nonconvex, and convex decoders across multiple resolutions (32,64,128,192,256) and feature dimensions (32,64,128). Use astronaut image as primary dataset. Measure PSNR, parameter efficiency, and training time. Hypothesis: K-Planes with linear decoders will achieve >5dB PSNR improvement over NeRF at equivalent parameter counts.
notes: Core experiment testing primary research hypothesis H1. Uses experiments/some_examples.py framework with systematic parameter sweeps.

title: Decoder Architecture Ablation Study
setup: Controlled ablation study comparing linear vs nonconvex vs convex decoders using fixed K-Planes backbone. Test on multiple image types including natural images and synthetic patterns. Measure reconstruction quality, training dynamics, and parameter efficiency. Fixed architecture: K-Planes with 128-dimensional features, resolution 256x256.
notes: Tests hypothesis H2 about decoder importance. Controls for architecture differences to isolate decoder impact.

title: Quantization-Aware Training (QAT) Impact Study
setup: Compare full precision vs 4-bit quantized models using QAT with straight-through estimators. Test on best-performing architectures from exp-001. Measure quality degradation vs compression gains. Use QuantizedModel wrapper with 4-bit quantization on plane features. Evaluate compressed model size vs PSNR trade-offs.
notes: Tests practical deployment considerations. Uses existing QuantizationSTE implementation from some_examples.py.

title: Sparse Training with Top-K Projection
setup: Evaluate sparse training using top-k projection on plane features during optimization. Test different sparsity levels (1%, 5%, 10%, 25%, 50%) on K-Planes and GA-Planes architectures. Compare parameter efficiency and reconstruction quality. Use existing sparse_project() function with various k values.
notes: Tests hypothesis H3 about parameter efficiency. Explores compression through sparsity rather than quantization.

title: Operation Type Comparison (Multiplicative vs Additive)
setup: Systematic comparison of multiplicative (f_u * f_v) vs additive (f_u + f_v) operations in K-Planes architecture. Fixed parameters: 128 feature dimensions, 256 resolution, linear decoder. Test on diverse image types to evaluate geometric bias implications. Measure convergence speed and final reconstruction quality.
notes: Tests geometric bias hypothesis. Multiplicative operations may better capture 2D structure than additive.
